nodes.bodyText:
on Xcode the message appears as


'success' is deprecated: Use `resolve()`

So I think it would be better to use it like this

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                @available(*, deprecated, message: "Use `resolve()`")
          
          
            
                @available(*, deprecated, message: "Use 'resolve'")
          
      
    
    
  

so it appears as 'success' is deprecated: Use 'resolve'
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -62,10 +62,12 @@ public typealias PluginEventListener = CAPPluginCall
         return self.options.index(forKey: key) != nil
     }
 
+    @available(*, deprecated, message: "Use `resolve()`")

nodes.bodyText: If I use renamed: "resolve" then this is the message that appears and there's an option to fix automatically:
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -62,10 +62,12 @@ public typealias PluginEventListener = CAPPluginCall
         return self.options.index(forKey: key) != nil
     }
 
+    @available(*, deprecated, message: "Use `resolve()`")
